body.p: The IETF tn3270e Working Group defines standards for 3270 and 5250 over TCP/IP. These standards make use of the existing Telnet standards.

dl.dd: 5250 Telnet Enhancements. This standard extends RFC 1250 and includes a useful list of references in section 13.

body.p: These documents are available online from IBM and include information relevant to the tn5250 project.

dl.dd: AS/400 International Application Development V4R2. Appendices A and F describe the EBCDIC and ASCII character sets that the AS/400 supports.
AS/400 National Language Support V4R2. Further information about character sets, especially as it relates to display devices.
CDRA Reference. Even more information about how character sets work on the AS/400, and how conversion between them should work.
OS/400 Communications Configuration V4R1. Chapter 8 defines the parameters that may be passed to the AS/400 over the telnet connection to configure the display or printer device.
APPC Password Substitution. This describes the currently unimplemented scheme used for automatic signon.

body.p: The final document above is Postscript, and almost follows the Document Structuring Conventions which allow programs like gv to go forwards and backwards through the document. A small Perl script splitpwsfont.pl extracts the fonts and document into separate files. You can then set GS_FONTPATH to point at these files while running gv: env GS_FONTPATH=$PWD gv pwsubs.ps.
